item.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Storage
item.description: Amazon S3 offers a range of storage classes that you can choose based on your workload’s data access, resiliency, and cost requirements.

item.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Database
item.description: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Database The AWS Cloud Practitioner certificate is an entry-level credential that introduces the basics of cloud computing and AWS services whichl also include cloud concepts, pricing, security, and the global infrastructure.

item.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Common Test Questions
item.description: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Questions that come up often in tests To prepare for this certification, you should first understand the role of an AWS Cloud process and then comprehend the significance of each terminology, when and how to implement them.

item.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Resources
item.description: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Resources To prepare for this certification, you should first understand the role of an AWS Cloud process and then comprehend the significance of each terminology, when and how to implement them.

item.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner Intro
item.description: AWS Cloud Practitioner-Intro The AWS Cloud Practitioner certificate is an entry-level credential that introduces the basics of cloud computing and AWS services whichl also include cloud concepts, pricing, security, and the global infrastructure.

item.title: Java OOP
item.description: Java Object-Oriented Programming Three major Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts in Java are Encapsulation, Inheritance, and Polymorphism.

item.title: Java Introduction
item.description: Java Java is a programming language and computing platform first released by Sun Microsystems in 1995, and it is owned by Oracle, and more than 3 billion devices run Java.
